top_comments.comment: Hey guys,  Last Night of the Proms “Jerusalem”. Words William Blake/Milton n music Hubert Parry.  Check out the composition it’s beautiful. Back in the 80’s on the river in Cambridge, as the punt in front of us stopped under a bridge, a girl got up from the stern and sang Jerusalem. Phenomenal acoustics. It was a golden moment that still transports me to another world.

Two quick comments:

1) Mad props for including choral music (I'm a choral conductor). Please share more cool vocal and choral music on this channel (and if you want some pointers, get in touch 😃). Parry is considered to have had an impact on Elgar's music, and he also taught Holst and Vaughan Williams! He has a lot of really great vocal and church music.

2) Sibelius' Sapin is part of a collection (op.75) of five short piano pieces. Sibelius did indeed write stuff like this basically to make money, and didn't care too much for the piano. The piece is really nice though, and the other ones in the opus are interesting too!

Please keep making more videos like this Twoset!
I just want to hang out with you two. I think your enthusiasm is infectious. I love your personal comments. I will bring the beer and listen to clips for an evening?

Bantock, Celtic Symphony, last movement. Rachmaninov, O Mother of God vigilantly praying. Rued Langgaard, String Quartets 2, 3, 6 and Variations on 'Mig Hjertellig nu Lenges'. Petris Vasks, violin concerto, Distant Light. Mendelssohn, Sonata in B flat. Some of my favourite underrated works for classical music.

comments_since_last_sample.body: I would love to see a top 10 of band ensemble or band heavy orchestral music. I would love to say I'm a french horn musician but it's easily been 10 years for me though I remember some pretty fantastic pieces we played anyway. Please consider this and thanks either way.
